paragraphs.content: Chapter 5
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 5

paragraphs.content: Hear ye this word which I take up against you, even a lamentation, O house of Israel.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hear ye this word which I take up against you, even a lamentation, O house of Israel.

paragraphs.content: The virgin of Israel is fallen; she shall no more rise: she is forsaken upon her land; there is none to raise her up.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The virgin of Israel is fallen; she shall no more rise: she is forsaken upon her land; there is none to raise her up.

paragraphs.content: For thus saith the Lord GOD; The city that went out by a thousand shall leave an hundred, and that which went forth by an hundred shall leave ten, to the house of Israel.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For thus saith the Lord God; The city that went out by a thousand shall leave an hundred, and that which went forth by an hundred shall leave ten, to the house of Israel.

paragraphs.content: ¶ For thus saith the LORD unto the house of Israel, Seek ye me, and ye shall live:
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ For thus saith the Lord unto the house of Israel, Seek ye me, and ye shall live:

paragraphs.content: But seek not Beth-el, nor enter into Gilgal, and pass not to Beer-sheba: for Gilgal shall surely go into captivity, and Beth-el shall come to nought.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But seek not Beth-el, nor enter into Gilgal, and pass not to Beer-sheba: for Gilgal shall surely go into captivity, and Beth-el shall come to nought.

paragraphs.content: Seek the LORD, and ye shall live; lest he break out like fire in the house of Joseph, and devour it, and there be none to quench it in Beth-el.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Seek the Lord, and ye shall live; lest he break out like fire in the house of Joseph, and devour it, and there be none to quench it in Beth-el.

paragraphs.content: Ye who turn judgment to wormwood, and leave off righteousness in the earth,
paragraphs.contentHtml: Ye who turn judgment to wormwood, and leave off righteousness in the earth,

paragraphs.content: Seek him that maketh the seven stars and Orion, and turneth the shadow of death into the morning, and maketh the day dark with night: that calleth for the waters of the sea, and poureth them out upon the face of the earth: The LORD is his name:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Seek him that maketh the seven stars and Orion, and turneth the shadow of death into the morning, and maketh the day dark with night: that calleth for the waters of the sea, and poureth them out upon the face of the earth: The Lord is his name:

paragraphs.content: That strengtheneth the spoiled against the strong, so that the spoiled shall come against the fortress.
paragraphs.contentHtml: That strengtheneth the spoiled against the strong, so that the spoiled shall come against the fortress.

paragraphs.content: They hate him that rebuketh in the gate, and they abhor him that speaketh uprightly.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They hate him that rebuketh in the gate, and they abhor him that speaketh uprightly.

paragraphs.content: Forasmuch therefore as your treading is upon the poor, and ye take from him burdens of wheat: ye have built houses of hewn stone, but ye shall not dwell in them; ye have planted pleasant vineyards, but ye shall not drink wine of them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Forasmuch therefore as your treading is upon the poor, and ye take from him burdens of wheat: ye have built houses of hewn stone, but ye shall not dwell in them; ye have planted pleasant vineyards, but ye shall not drink wine of them.

paragraphs.content: For I know your manifold transgressions and your mighty sins: they afflict the just, they take a bribe, and they turn aside the poor in the gate from their right.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For I know your manifold transgressions and your mighty sins: they afflict the just, they take a bribe, and they turn aside the poor in the gate from their right.

paragraphs.content: Therefore the prudent shall keep silence in that time; for it is an evil time.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Therefore the prudent shall keep silence in that time; for it is an evil time.

paragraphs.content: Seek good, and not evil, that ye may live: and so the LORD, the God of hosts, shall be with you, as ye have spoken.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Seek good, and not evil, that ye may live: and so the Lord, the God of hosts, shall be with you, as ye have spoken.

paragraphs.content: Hate the evil, and love the good, and establish judgment in the gate: it may be that the LORD God of hosts will be gracious unto the remnant of Joseph.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hate the evil, and love the good, and establish judgment in the gate: it may be that the Lord God of hosts will be gracious unto the remnant of Joseph.

paragraphs.content: Therefore the LORD, the God of hosts, the Lord, saith thus; Wailing shall be in all streets; and they shall say in all the highways, Alas! alas! and they shall call the husbandman to mourning, and such as are skilful of lamentation to wailing.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Therefore the Lord, the God of hosts, the Lord, saith thus; Wailing shall be in all streets; and they shall say in all the highways, Alas! alas! and they shall call the husbandman to mourning, and such as are skilful of lamentation to wailing.

paragraphs.content: And in all vineyards shall be wailing: for I will pass through thee, saith the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And in all vineyards shall be wailing: for I will pass through thee, saith the Lord.

paragraphs.content: Woe unto you that desire the day of the LORD! to what end is it for you? the day of the LORD is darkness, and not light.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Woe unto you that desire the day of the Lord! to what end is it for you? the day of the Lord is darkness, and not light.

paragraphs.content: As if a man did flee from a lion, and a bear met him; or went into the house, and leaned his hand on the wall, and a serpent bit him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: As if a man did flee from a lion, and a bear met him; or went into the house, and leaned his hand on the wall, and a serpent bit him.

paragraphs.content: Shall not the day of the LORD be darkness, and not light? even very dark, and no brightness in it?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Shall not the day of the Lord be darkness, and not light? even very dark, and no brightness in it?

paragraphs.content: ¶ I hate, I despise your feast days, and I will not smell in your solemn assemblies.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ I hate, I despise your feast days, and I will not smell in your solemn assemblies.

paragraphs.content: Though ye offer me burnt offerings and your meat offerings, I will not accept them: neither will I regard the peace offerings of your fat beasts.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Though ye offer me burnt offerings and your meat offerings, I will not accept them: neither will I regard the peace offerings of your fat beasts.

paragraphs.content: Take thou away from me the noise of thy songs; for I will not hear the melody of thy viols.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Take thou away from me the noise of thy songs; for I will not hear the melody of thy viols.

paragraphs.content: But let judgment run down as waters, and righteousness as a mighty stream.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But let judgment run down as waters, and righteousness as a mighty stream.

paragraphs.content: Have ye offered unto me sacrifices and offerings in the wilderness forty years, O house of Israel?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Have ye offered unto me sacrifices and offerings in the wilderness forty years, O house of Israel?

paragraphs.content: But ye have borne the tabernacle of your Moloch and Chiun your images, the star of your god, which ye made to yourselves.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But ye have borne the tabernacle of your Moloch and Chiun your images, the star of your god, which ye made to yourselves.

paragraphs.content: Therefore will I cause you to go into captivity beyond Damascus, saith the LORD, whose name is The God of hosts.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Therefore will I cause you to go into captivity beyond Damascus, saith the Lord, whose name is The God of hosts.
